titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marguerite V. Doggett papers 1980.012
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:25 +0000.

did.abstract: The Margureite V. Dogget papers span the period 1975 to 1980 and measure 0.4 linear feet. The papers primarily consist of an unedited manuscript of her book, Long Island Printing, 1791-1830: A Checklist of Imprints. Also included are press releases, reviews, and correspondence concerning the book, which was printed in 1978 by the Long Island Historical Society. Each printer documented in the book is listed chronologically by county, and town within county, with biographies of each of the printers. An appendix provides a list of authors associated with the printing industry in Long Island.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Marguerite V. Doggett papers, 1980.012, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1980.
